relation: Select this check box to narrow the Users list as defined by the Choose/Change the Authorization Type Screen.
Displays the Choose/Change the Authorization Type Screen.
Shows the users that match the filter settings. See the Choose/Change the Authorization Type Screen for column descriptions.
textBeforeTable: The Select Users screen is used to add user logins to an alias. To access this screen, click Add on the Add New Alias/Edit Alias Screen. A.2.4.12 Select Users Screen Deletes the selected user login from the alias. Delete button Displays the Select Users Screen. Add button Lists the user logins that are included in the alias. Users list Maximum 80 characters. Description field Name of the alias that appears on a display. Alias Display Name field The alias name is limited to 30 characters. The following are not allowed: spaces, tabs, line feeds, returns and ; : ^ ? @ & + " # % < * ~ | Alias Name field Description Element
textAfterTable: A.2.4.13 Sub-Administration Interface: Edit Rights Screen The Edit Rights screen is used to assign sub-administration rights to a role. To access this screen, select a role and click Edit Applet Rights on the Permissions By Role Screen. Element Description Rights.Apps.UserAdmin check box Assigns sub-administration rights to the User Admin application. Rights.Apps.WebLayout check box Assigns sub-administration rights to the Web Layout Editor application. Rights.Apps.RepMan check box Assigns sub-administration rights to the Repository Manager application. Rights.Apps.Workflow check box Assigns sub-administration rights to the Workflow Admin application.
